fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynvcacl.components

Class AsynchronousVectorCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components.AsynchronousCalculator
        • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynvcacl.components.AsynchronousVectorCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI

    public class AsynchronousVectorCalculator
extends AsynchronousCalculator
    The class AsynchronousVectorCalculator implements an asynchronous calculator component that adds the capability to compute over vector arguments to the capability of AsynchronousCalculator to compute over scalar ones, and it does so by computing all results in parallel.

    Description

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2020-05-06

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected AsynchronousCalculatorServicesInboundPort createPort()
      create the inbound port of the component offering the component interface AsynchronousCalculatorServicesCI; the use of a method to create this port allows to change the component interface and the port to ones that are extending the current interface and port by simply redefining this method in a subclass.
      protected void initialise()
      initialise the component.
      void vectorAddition(double[] xs, double[] ys, long serialNo, java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
      add each of the first operands with each of the second and return an array of the results by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial number allows the caller to identify its call when receiving the result.
      void vectorSubtraction(double[] xs, double[] ys, long serialNo, java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
      subtract each of the first operands with each of the second and return an array of the results by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial number allows the caller to identify its call when receiving the result.

      • vectorAddition

        public void vectorAddition(double[] xs,
                           double[] ys,
                           long serialNo,
                           java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        add each of the first operands with each of the second and return an array of the results by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial number allows the caller to identify its call when receiving the result.

        Contract

         pre     xs != null && ys != null && xs.length == ys.length
 pre     resultReceptionInboundPortURI != null && !resultReceptionInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        xs - first vector operand.
        ys - second vector operand.
        serialNo - serial number of the call.
        resultReceptionInboundPortURI - URI of the port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI to return the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
